New Records: SGA passed Gary Payton for the second most games in franchise history with 30+ points on 70%+ shooting
Dyson Daniels is on pace to become the first player to average 3+ steals since Alvin Robertson in 1990-91
Dyson Daniels is also averaging 6.6 deflections per game, on pace to set a new single-season record since deflections began being tracked nine seasons ago
Key Match Events: Thunder 126, Knicks 101: Sparked by a 30-9 run spanning the 1st and 2nd quarters and a combined 70 points from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (39 pts, 71.4% FG) and Isaiah Joe (31 pts, career-high 8 3pm)

Bucks 109, Magic 106: Paolo (34 pts, 5 3pm) showed no rust after his 72-day absence, but a combined 70 points from Giannis Antetokounmpo (41 pts, 14 reb) and Damian Lillard (29 pts) was too much to overcome

Nuggets 124, Nets 105: JokiÄ‡ (35 pts, 12 reb, 15 ast) and Westbrook (25 pts, 11 reb, 10 ast) became the first teammates to each record a triple-double in the same game multiple times in a single season
Pre-Game Insights: Experts highlighted the duel between Ja Morant and Anthony Edwards as the key matchup of the day
The matchup between the 3rd and 7th teams in the West, respectively, was expected to be a thrilling one
Post-Match Reflections: Thunder coach Mark Daigneault praised SGA for his defense and the ascension of his teammates
Giannis Antetokounmpo reflected on the Bucks' win, saying it was a team effort
Paolo Banchero expressed his excitement to be back on the court after his 72-day absence
Miscellaneous Highlights: The NBA postponed Saturday's home games for the Lakers and Clippers due to the ongoing wildfires in the Los Angeles area
The entire NBA, NBPA, WNBA and WNBPA family sent their thoughts and support to the community of Los Angeles during this challenging time
Dyson Daniels' defensive energy has lifted the Hawks on both ends, as they rank second in steals and third in pace
Others: The Kia MVP Ladder has a new leader, with Shai Gilgeous-Alexander sitting atop the list for the first time this season
Victor Wembanyama continues to climb the ladder, posting 28.8 points, 3.7 3s, 11.5 boards and 5.0 blocks in his last 12 games
